Authors: Benawa A., Martoredjo N.T., Laurentius L.Y.
Title: The effect of lecturer leadership and organizational culture on the students' SPIRIT character building
Source title: Proceedings - 2017 10th International Conference on Human System Interactions, HSI 2017
Affiliations: CBDC, Marketing Communication Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; CBDC, Technical Information Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Benawa, A., CBDC, Marketing Communication Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Martoredjo, N.T., CBDC, Technical Information Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Laurentius, L.Y., CBDC, Technical Information Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: The long-term goal of this research is to accommodate the students' perceptions of the influence of the lecturer's leadership and the organizational culture to the students' SPIRIT character development. The method that be used in this research is by distributing questionnaires to the respondents and the data obtained were processed quantitatively with path analysis. The results showed that the leadership of the lecturer did not have significant influence, because it only accounted for 12.1%, while the effect of organizational culture on the students' SPIRIT character development is also not significant, which amounted to 6.4%. It can be concluded that the leadership and organizational culture have no significant effect on the students' SPIRIT character development. So, it is very necessary to develop leadership and organizational culture in order to give significant effect to the students' SPIRIT character building. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Culture organization; Leadership; SPIRIT character building
Index Keywords: Regression analysis; Surveys; Leadership; Long-term goals; Organizational cultures; Path analysis; Students
Funding Text 1: ACKNOWLEDGMENT This work was supported in part by Bina Nusantara University under BINUS Research Grant.

Authors: Benawa A., Laurentius L., Irawan I.
Title: Improving students’ learning motivation by increasing lecturer’s ability and learning model
Affiliations: CBMKU, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Benawa, A., CBMKU, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Laurentius, L., CBMKU, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Irawan, I., CBMKU, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: The purpose of the research is to study the effect of lecturer’s ability in managing class and learning model on student learning motivation. The research was conducted in Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta with a sample of 150 respondents selected randomly. This research used path analysis method. The result shows that there is positive direct effect of (1) lecturer’s ability in managing class, (2) and learning model, on the student’s learning motivation. The conclusion is (a) if lecturer’s ability in managing class is higher, it can increase student’s learning motivation; (b) if learning model is more precise, it can improve student’s learning motivation; (c) if lecturer’s ability in managing class is higher and the learning model is precise, student’s learning motivation can also be higher. © 2017 American Scientific Publishers All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: Learning model; Learning motivation; Lecturer’s ability
References: Arend, R.I., (2008) Learning to Teach, Helly Parjitno (Indonesia Translation), , Pustaka Belajar, Yogyakarta; Beck, R.C., (1990) Motivation: Theories and Principles, , Prentice Hall, New Jersey; Joyce, B., Weil, M., Calhoun, E., (2008) Models of Teaching, , 8th edn., Pearson, New York; Buchari, B., (1994) Management and Motivation, , Ghalia Indonesia, Jakarta; Kuny, F.B., (2012) The Effect of Quantum Learning Model Learning on Motivation Learning Practice Tailoring men’s Clothing at SMKN 6 Purworedjo, , S2 Thesis, State University of Yogyakarta; http://www.hcc.hawaii.edu/intranet/committees/FacDevCom/guidebk/guidebk.htm, Honolulu Community College, Faculty Development, Faculty Guidebook, Learning Assumptions, Hawaii; Izuddin, S., (2012) The Effect of Application of Blended Learning Model on Student Achievement Motivation at SMK Negeri 1 Paringin, , S2 Thesis, State University of Yogyakarta; Kadir, S., (2010), Rosemata Sampurna, Jakarta; Lindsay, W.M., (1997) Total Quality and Organization Development, , St. Lucie Press, Florida; Meier, D., Dramatically reduce learning time while covering more a material, improve training result by getting learners actively involved, cut course design time from weeks to hours—bring the joy of learning back into training (2000) The Accelerated Learning Handbook, pp. 54-55. , McGraw-Hill, New York; Huda, M., (2011) Cooperative Learning: Methods, Techniques, Structure, and Application Model, , Pustaka Pelajar, Yogyakarta; Rockler, M.J., Innovative Teaching Strategies, , Gorsuch Scarisbrick Publishers, Arinzona; Romiszowski, A.J., (1984) Designing Instructional Systems: Decision Making in Course Planning and Curriculum Design, , Routledge Falmer, England; Rusman, (2011) Models of Learning: Developing Teachers’ Professionalism, , Rajawali, Jakarta; Siarta, M.I., (2012) Undiksha Graduate Research Journal, p. 2; (2015), Sloving, Steph Ellen, eHowBlog, with reference to Principles and Methods of Research, edited by Ariola et al.
